intro: Urostigma consociatum, commonly known as the clustered urostigma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are often arranged in clusters, giving it its common name. Its leaves are lance-shaped and usually have a rough texture. Urostigma consociatum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
